channel.title: Monitor problem
channel.description:
My new monitor arrived today, and it's working quite fine. However, I'm keeping my old monitor to the side of it, but ever since connecting both monitors, the old monitor, a HP w1907v, has a black gap to the left side of the screen, compressing the width of the screen. I've tried fucking about with the settings, tried a different VGA cable, but nothing worked. The screen is stable and doesn't flicker, like it did before I installed the newest catalyst, but this is annoying me.
How do I fix it?

item.title: Monitor problem
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

sppt:

Somehow, resetting some setting in CCCP has fixed it.

ftfy

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor problem
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Could it be that Windows is fucking it up due to the different aspect ratios? The new one is 16:9, whereas the old one is 16:10

Edit: Even when scaling it up and moving it to the left, the blackness around the screen still exists.

Just to demonstrate it:

Edit2:
Well, wtf.
Somehow, resetting some setting in CCC has fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Monitor problem
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

There is a option in the screen menu where you can adjust the image by moving it left right up down. If not that then adjust the horizontal width to make it wider.

Read full topic
